data.title: Map Chooser: Make the client remember your latest view.
data.body:
For convenience sake I'd love to see the map chooser going to the latest map tab (Official/Custom) and map type (if chosen) for the map I've not only played, but also looked at. Currently, when switching back and forth between the map chooser and the lobby without selecting a map (happens frequently for various reasons) the map chooser starts with the _picked_ map's tab and centers on this map's position.

This would also be very convenient when looking through maps with the Editor's map chooser as well. Currently the Editor's map chooser solely remember the view from a selected map in a game lobby.

data.title: [Rendering] [TS] "Alpha light images" disappears when scrolling around
data.body:
One of the Depth-buffer Pr`s introduce an "Cut-Away"-Effect while scrolling.

Reproduce case:
1. Start TS in bleed
2. Load the map "town of ka..." (the snow map)
3. Enter "/all"
4. Scroll around the map and look to the light posts`s Alpha images!

data.title: Utility crash when trying to make check
data.body:
Ever since #11058 was merged, I'm getting a weird utility crash when trying to `make check`. Something about

> method `get_GLVersion` in type `OpenRA.Platforms.Null.NullGraphicsDevice` (...) has no implementation

Since the utility crashes on that, I can't run style checks locally at the moment.

Cleaning and refetching dependencies didn't help.

data.title: Emp cannon support power
data.body:
Adds a new `AttackOrderPower` which orders the unit to attack the selected location and stops after one shot.

Fixes #7349

https://streamable.com/ekh8
https://streamable.com/2sv6
https://streamable.com/qcyd

With `AllowMultiple: true`: https://streamable.com/iex9
##### Possible issues mentioned in comments:
- No beacon or camera support
- No burst weapon support (cannon stops after the first shot) - Solved with #11158
- `self.World.IssueOrder(new Order("Stop", self, false));` has to be removed (!)
##### Outstanding polishing issues not covered by this pr:
- ~~Targeter works only for one EMP cannon and doesn't check for other cannons in the area~~
- ~~Reset emp range to original value~~
- ~~Set proper Armament local offset and yaw~~
- No charge animation
- Charging end sound is the same for all factions
- Select target sound is the same for all factions

data.title: "Forced" targeting frindlies / allies
data.body: So, in the original game, even if you were allies with another player, you could hit control and target them still.  Mostly with things like engineers to take over buildings or hijackers to get their units out of your way... among other things.  I have found that this does not work.  I can get my guys to shoot at my guys, but not have an engineer take over a building of an ally.

data.title: Fix submarines not being attackable when surfaced
data.body:
This will also fix the issue of all pre-placed subs playing the submerging sound during the start of a map.

Fixes #11046.

data.title: Fix ready checkbox in the lobby being unusable after installing a map
data.body:
Fixes #11074.

Cause of the bug was that the `RulesLoaded` flag in the `MapPreview` was false after installing the map, so we needed to trigger loading the rules manually.

data.title: Fix grenadier damage vs heavy and concrete

milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Currently the grenadier does 5 damage per hit on ALL defense structures because it uses the heavy armor class (the only structures that do)
The grenadier also does its full damage to concrete walls because concrete isn't defined in the weapons

data.body:
OpenRA 20151224
Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie) 32-Bit , Gnome 3.14.1

on linux (for me it seems) ... when i try to alt-tab (whilst ingame) although there isnt any other program running beside openra , almost every hotkey stops working including "Esc" all the  "F-Keys" and "Stance-Hotkeys"  (Enter works) apart from that , i lose the ability to do stuff with "right click" such as giving attack/move-order for example

10:52:58        +chrisf | it's an sdl bug , tap alt again and everything will start working

data.title: Replace SheetType.DualIndexed with secondary texture coordinates on Vertex.
data.body:
In the current renderer we have two cases where we care about _two_ indices per pixel:
- Voxels (color + normal)
- Terrain (color + depth)

Both of these have a one-to-one relationship between the two components: every pixel has its own unique normal/depth value.  This was supported with a kind-of-hacky-but-works setup where we reserved every second channel in the sprite sheet for this extra data, and assumed/enforced that the secondary data for a given pixel was at the same x/y coord and channel + 1.

Supporting depth data for regular sprites is more complicated: there is a single depth map (buildngz.shp) that is shared for all building sprites.  Keeping the old implementation would be extremely wasteful of texture space because we would need to duplicate the same depth sprite for every regular sprite.

This PR reworks the "secondary texture data" concept by adding two extra components to the vertex format, which are interpreted as a secondary texture coordinate.  The secondary channel index is merged in to the channel component and extracted in the vertex shader.  This introduces a little waste for the classic mods (they will always be pushing two unused floats to the GPU for each vertex), but this dramatically simplifies life for the gen2 mods who can now share the same depth sprite for all sprites on the same sheet.

Voxels and terrain are reworked using the new code, and the old DualIndexed code is dropped.

data.title: Allow Media.PlaySoundNotification() to playback AUD files from the map dir
data.body:
I have sounds I want only specific players to hear on some events.  Using Media.PlaySound() is the only way now, but it will be heard by all players (_i think_).  In the attached map file I have added 2 AUD files in map.yaml as notification:

```
Notifications:
    Sounds:
        Notifications:
            onlyyou: ONLYYOU.AUD
            everyone: EVERYONE.AUD
```

In my map.lua there are 2 functions, one calls:

```
1) Media.PlaySound("EVERYONE.AUD")
```

the other

```
2) Media.PlaySoundNotification(newowner, onlyyou)
```
#2 does not work at the moment, I would like this to play the ONLYYOU.AUD sound file.

In the attached map, start the game and use the provided engineers.  2 silos on top trigger #1, 2 bottom silos trigger #2.  Please let me know if I can give more help.
[test1.oramap.zip (zipped for GitHub)](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/211947/test1.oramap.zip)

data.title: Add depth buffer support for sprites.
data.body:
The next step towards #7520.

This enables the depth buffer properly for mods that define `EnableDepthBuffer` in their mod.yaml, and writes sensible data into the sprite z coordinates.  This fixes most of the "scroll the map and X disappears" issues from #11058 (but not for voxels or color effects), and gives the desired clipping behaviour for sprite based actors behind cliffs.

Large sprite actors (buildings) are partly clipped below the terrain: this is expected, and will be fixed in a future PR that adds support for per-sprite depth maps.  The clip level is not actually ground level because of the way the terrain depth is defined.  That will be fixed in the next PR.  It also disables the old per-sprite depth preview (with `EnableDepthBuffer` disabled), because that is no longer useful and it would be a pain to maintain support for it.

Github has also buggered up the commit order in their preview, as usual.  The "TEST COMMIT" is the head commit, and should be removed before merging.
